markdownRemark.excerpt: Software development, as an industry, has a constant struggle with shipping quality code. While many developers have metrics for what quality means, there’s a…
markdownRemark.html:
Software development, as an industry, has a constant struggle with shipping quality code. While many developers have metrics for what quality means, there’s a challenge in ensuring these metrics are met especially as a codebase grows over time.

We build our computer systems the way we build our cities: over time, without a plan, and on top of ruins.

- Ellen Ullman

While software development is a relatively young field, there are more established industries that we can learn from to help us write better code.

frontmatter.title: The magic of a mise en place mindset for frontend development
Windows Subsystem for Linux for JavaScript development
